title: How to Make a Hot Dog Octopus

steps.title: You can use any kind of hot dog you like!
steps.content: You can use any kind of hot dog you like! Hot Dog Octopuses are often made with Japanese Pork Sausages because they are 3 inches in length. You can also use beef hot dogs or any other type of sausage, so long as you cut them in half. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut a slit all the way through to the bottom.
steps.content: Cut a slit all the way through to the bottom. Start about an inch (2.54 cm) from the topâ€”this would make 2 legs. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the hot dog 90 degrees to the uncut side and repeat.
steps.content: Turn the hot dog 90 degrees to the uncut side and repeat. This would make 4 legs so far. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Hold 3 legs up and look "inside".
steps.content: Hold 3 legs up and look "inside". You are going to cut the "ridge" of the 4th leg, matching the length of the cuts. One of these slits is going to make 2 legs. Repeat for the 3 other legs to make 8 legs total. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Be aware that the legs will curl up in the process.
steps.content: Be aware that the legs will curl up in the process. So, be sure that there's enough room in the pot. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the hot dogs are as dry as possible before serving.
steps.content: Make sure the hot dogs are as dry as possible before serving. You may want to pat the hot dog octopuses dry with a paper towel or cloth.

steps.title: You can serve your hot dog octopus over rice.
steps.content: You can serve your hot dog octopus over rice. You can also serve it over a bed of mixed vegetables, or over noodles! Feel free to get creative. For even more fun, add eyes to your octopus with sesame seeds.
